Hello again.

Now i have cleaned the blade from that old grease (almost all=
 of it), in my opinon i thinks its look ok, some small rust spots on the ki=
ssaki, not any big damages on the blade it so i think its ok, in the higher=
 part of it someone have tuched it in a bad way i think, im pretty sure tha=
t the guy that put the fingers there dont tuch a Japanese sword again whito=
ut thinking twice before he does it..... he leaved spots on it from when he=
 tuch it on both sides of the edge of the blade, and im pretty sure that he=
 cut the fingers on it, kind of bad...it was and it is really sharp.

Also =
have some pictures of the Saya here, what about the iron work on tip of the=
 Saya?? was that normal?

And now the final question, can anyone tell me ab=
out the Mei=B4s on the "Kazuka"??

Here is the final photos of it, its hard=
 to take good picture of a blade that the flash just fight back from.

http=
://photobucket.com/albums/b196/swedeman/JapaneseSword/


Thanks again to yo=
u all for all the help.

Best Regards

Patrik

  Alan, Patrik et all. I thought this mei read Shin Fujiwara Yoshi=
kuni and 
  was having trouble finding a listing. Is the Shin and Fuji char=
acters 
  Shinto ( an alternative reading ) or is Shin just an abreviation =
for 
  Shinto.


  Cheers

  Richard Turner
